q: If two lines intersect, the vertically opposite angles are always:
explanation: The vertically opposite angles formed by two intersecting lines are always equal.

q: An angle which is greater than 180° but less than 360° is called:
explanation: By definition, a reflex angle lies between 180 and 360 degrees.

q: If two complementary angles are in the ratio 2:3, then the angles are:
If a ray stands on a line, then the sum of the two adjacent angles so formed is:
explanation: This is known as the Linear Pair Axiom.

q: If two parallel lines are intersected by a transversal, then the interior angles on the same side of the transversal are:
explanation: Consecutive interior angles (co-interior) between parallel lines sum up to 180°.
